Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Helena S
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all at the Hotel Dorica for a very pleasant and comfortable stay. Rooms were kept immaculately clean and tidy. Breakfast was good - excellent choice. Hotel within easy access of all the main attractions. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend you. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Pete and Joy, soon to be as ancient as Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Petefromleek
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dorica, Rome We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Dorica Hotel, and would like to extend a huge thank you to Marco and his staff. As many previous reviews have already stated, they were all very, very friendly and helpful. Particularly, I would like to thank those members of staff (all of them!) who helped me with my conversational Italian. I left England with no Italian whatsoever, but returned almost fluent – well OK, so I exaggerate a bit there! Prior to our trip, Marco wrote to us to see if we wanted to have a taxi pick us up at the airport, which was very helpful, and we were tempted. However, since the hotel was less than 10 mins by foot from Termini Station, we decided to take the “My Terravision” bus, which saved us €92 over the two journeys, which we figured would be better off put towards a bottle or two of wine! On arrival at the hotel, we were given a detailed map of Central Rome, which was brilliant because it listed all the streets, as opposed to the maps in our guidebooks which only showed the larger streets. We had a rough idea what we were going to do with several walks planned, so this map was well used. Bear in mind that it is not really necessary to use Public Transport, so comfortable shoes are essential. Just ask my wife!!!!! Apart from the walks, we went on one of the “hop on, hop off” buses. We stayed on for a complete circuit before carrying on to our destination. It cost €21 each (valid for 24 hours), but it gives you a different perspective of the city, plus the commentary is very interesting. We wanted to do a boat trip too, but it was too early in the season, and so they were not running. We didn’t do the Vatican tour, but if you do, pre-book your tickets and go first thing in the morning, as the queues become vast as the day goes on. We went to football (wherever we go my wife insists that we go!!), but beware! I don’t know about Lazio tickets (Marco will tell you where to get them from), but AS Roma tickets were only available from the club shop in The Piazza Colonna, off the Via Del Corso, and not from any of the other Roma shops, as far as I know. You will need a passport or driving licence (with a photo on, I think) for each ticket, and you must take this ID with you when you go to the ground. We’re a couple in our late 50’s but our ID was checked three times at the ground!. Also, you cannot get tickets on the day of the game. Our tickets said the KO was 1500, but when we went back to the Dorica to get the tickets and passports, Marco told us that it was a 1230 KO, and despite his getting us a taxi to get to the ground, we still missed the start of the match. So get your hotel to check when the KO is, if you go to the football, and don’t forget your passports. Apart from the walks during the day, the other thing we did was the “Ghost and Mystery Walking Tour (pre-book on viator.com). This was not actually a ghost walk at all, but featured some of the “dark side” of Rome’s history, and was very interesting and enjoyable. It was well worth doing, but we were flagging by the end of it (after walking all day, the walk was from 2115 to about 2315). I won’t go into detail of the main sites to see, as you’ll all have your own ideas as to what you want to see, so now it’s time for the important stuff. Obviously drinks are expensive in the centre, so buy your water at a supermarket before your reach the centre. There are many “DESPAR” and “CARREFOUR” supermarkets around, so you’ll soon find one. If you stop for a beer and people watch, bear in mind that there is usually a three tier price system. It is cheaper to stand up at the bar/counter, a bit more for a table indoors and dearer still to sit outside. We did pay €6 for a beer (0.2L), so be warned. There are many eating places that do set menus, and we did one on the night that we did the “Ghost Walk”, and it was very good, so don’t be put off by thinking that the quality/quantity will be poor. We actually ate close to the hotel on all five nights, and although our bill varied between €30 to €90 (drinks cost us over half of this last one), the best meal we had was at EST-EST-EST, across from the hotel, off the Via Palermo. I’m not one who would normally rave over a pizza, but the Calzone was one of the best tasting meals I’ve ever had. We had to go back next day too! (Bear in mind that it closes on Mondays, and that many other restaurants close on a Sunday.) A shared starter, two Calzone Pizzas and two Tiramisu desserts, and a litre of house white cost us €40. It was a divine meal. Having had five full days in Rome, we did everything that we wanted to do, so we would not expect to return, however, the Calzone Pizzas at EST-EST-Est are a tempting prospect!!! I’m sure there are many other tips I could pass on if I could remember them, but you’ll just have to make do with one more. When crossing the roads, pray first, close your eyes, and proceed as quickly as possible! Seriously, though, when crossing, try to cross at traffic lights when the green man says it’s OK, but watch out for cars driving either side of you. DO NOT STOP ON A CROSSING as the drivers work out whether to pass in front or behind you. If you stop, then I wouldn’t bother wasting any money in the Trevi Fountain! Enjoy. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Laimas
Reviews.Content: Good location, almost all sightseeings reachable in 10-20 minutes walking. Very very very friendly and helpfull staff: Marco, Owner and his daughter, also other. Rooms are not very small and very clean, bathroom is big enough and clean and everything worked, hot watter any time was available, clean towels also available every day. Breakfeast is simple, but really enough, I recommend the Capuccino. Maybe it could be nice to have a slice of normal fresh italian cheese and sausage or eggs, but nevertheless it was generaly OK. As we are not used, it was too noisy for us because of traffic in the street ant night. The same is with the sound of conditionair.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL DORICA”
Reviews.Author: Gandgeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Hotel. Hotel was clean and the staff were all brilliant and friendly, specially Marco. Checkout is as early as 12.00. Room are cleanned every day. 10 minutes walk from Termini Train/Underground Station. About 15/20 minutes walk to the historical part o the town. Bars and restaurants around were very good and resonably priced. Do not hesitate to ask the staff for recommendation. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Berwick on Tweed, null, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “KenF”
Reviews.Author: Ken F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights whilst visiting for a sports event. Hotel was clean and the staff were all brilliant and friendly - even when we arrived back very late at night when the front door was locked. It's more in a business type district, but it was a less expensive part of town, where the bars and restaurants around were good value compared with the trendier and historical site areas. They don't seem to do lunch / evening meals, but this wasn't a problem at all. Marco organised a taxi for us both ways to and from the airport and his English was impeccable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good area and close to the center. You can go everywhere by foot. Special thanks to Mr Marco for his kindness!

Reviews.Title: “great Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DecDubhlinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during Feb.The location is excellent,just a short wlk from Rome Termini.No more then 15 mins to the Colosseum and roughly about the same in the opposite direction for the Trevi The hotel is small & secure.The bedrooms and en suites were well cleaned.We found the staff to be extremely friendly and professional.No problem ordering taxis when leaving . The breakfast consists mainly of coffee,bread & pastries which sets you for the day quite well. The area around the hotel seems quite safe,There are Government buildings across the road so there are police around.The reception is on the first floor,and the main door is closed at night however the night bell was answered promptly. The only negitive thing I would say is that there can be a lot of Traffic noise at the front of the building even with the shutters closed,which may be a problem for a light sleeper. We thoroughly enjoyed our few days here and would have no problem booking this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: nugget00
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 days at Hotel Dorica in Rome and what a great experience it was. Close to the train station and walkable to many of the major sights. The staff were absolutely fantastic, thanks to Marco and all the staff that looked after us so well. The rooms were clean & spacious, the breakfasts plentiful & delicious and the restaurant tips all spot on!!! We would recommend Hotel Dorica to friends and when we return to Rome we will absolutely use them again. Well done team!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alison e
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights here for rhe 6nations rugby match and general sight seeing.the location is very good near to the main terminus. plenty of restaurants and bars nearby and the area felt safe.our room was a good size as was our bathroom and was very clean and lovely and warm.(it wa snowing outside). the staff were friendly and helpful. the breakfast was good with a choice of juice,cereal,yogurts,bread,cheese,jam,pastries,fruit and tea,coffee etc i would recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jovidaha
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here to cover the Italy v England rugby match. The room was adequate in size, clean and the en-suiute shower was spotless. This is not a luxury hotel but very good value and well placed within walking distance of the station and convinient to most of the attractions in Rome. If you go in cold weather, ask for an extra blanket and you will be quite comfortable. There is some traffic noise if you are at the front of the hotel, but this is Rome and it always seem to be busy. Breakfast is simple but enough to get you started. The staff were always friendly, cheerful and helpful and you can pay a lot more and not get that! This is a great choice for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “All perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaDimitra
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in the summer of 2011 and we are more than satisfied with hotel Dorica. It is perfectly located only 5 minutes walk to Republica metro station. It is next to Via Nationale, a crowded and commercial street so it is safe to walk there any time of the day or night. The hotel staff was really kind, friendly and helpful. They gave us not only the useful map of the important sightseeings but also their precious directions for the buses and the routes that we should follow so that we would not miss anything. The room was clean (daily change of linen!!) nice decorated and comfortable, we had hot water all the time. Breakfast was not served in a buffet but we had in our table all the amount of food that we needed. After all the staff was there to serve us supplement. Coffee was excellent!!!Perfect value for money! Dimitra and Maria from Greece!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Ideal everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: smudge198625_
Reviews.Content: We looked for somewhere cheap, central,comfortable and friendly and Hotel Dorica did not dissapoint. Everyone at the hotel was very polite and willing to help. Marco had excellent knowledge of where to eat and relax locally. The breakfast was fine and filling and offered variety. The location is 10 minute walk from the collesum, 20 minutes to the spanish steps and 30 minutes to the Vatican. We got given a map of what to do and little guidance from the hotel which was great. The room was cleaned and tidied daily and it was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KUNGSC
Reviews.Content: I stayed Dorica Hotel 2 night.All the empoyees were very polite. Thank you for your suggested italian restaurant,very delicacies. The location of the hotel is perfect.Very close to Termini station and scenic spots.Trevi Fountain,Piazza di Spagna and Roman Colosseum are just 1 Metro station far,which means you can go these places on foot. The Room very comfortable and very clean.The breakfast and service was very good and close to what i feel in 4* hotel. Only one problem is the shower area does not provide a screen to avoid the water drop on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vassilis A
Reviews.Content: I stayed Dorica Hotel 3 nights. Everything was perfect, Marco and Florian were extremely helpfull and always with a smile. All the empoyees were very polite. Clean room, close to many monuments and places that you have to go. The breakfast was very good also. In general, i left the Hotel with very best impressions. I will return definately. Thanks for everything. Vassilis

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murat A
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Always smiling. The breakfast was fantastic. The location of the hotel is perfect. Central Rome and quiet. Very close to Termini station. There is TV, Air conditioning, wireless internet and a safe box in the room. Very comfortable and very clean. Very warm atmosphere and reasonable price. I will stay there again if I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It's practical to stay at the Dorica”
Reviews.Author: AverageTraveller1
Reviews.Content: 1. Location - An easy walk to the Metro station at Piazza della Repubblica; also walkable from the Termini (especially if you're traveling light); very close to Via Nazionale, which is a very good non-touristy street for shopping (in fact, there are clothing-stores almost next door to the Dorica); a pleasant walk up the Quirinale to the Piazza di Santa Barberini, and further to the Spanish Steps and beyond (del Popolo); very close to the Maggiore cathedral; longer walks (a great thing to do in Rome!) or reasonable cab fares to the Colosseum and Forum in one direction, or to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona; not a lot of fine restaurants in the hotel's proximity, but quite a few very good coffee bars (at which, in Italy, there's also plenty to eat) 2. Breakfast (currently, 7:00 to 9:30) - Without being sensational, the Dorica's breakfast is more than adequate (a number of hotels have this sort of package); espresso is available on demand; Mario, Diana and their young assistant, with their great service, ensure a pleasant start to the morning; if you want more, there's the large Caffe Morganti next door (this used to be the Gran Caffe Piacente; Morganti is also good for buying a quick bottle of water, or for having a drink in the evening) 3. Service - I saw less of the gregarious owner, Peter, during this (my second) stay, but that's because he has very efficient people working at the hotel now; the spiffy Marco is a great communicator in English and will make sure to arrange airport transfers and to check with you on your experience with the taxi and the hotel; the taxis they work with are usually Mercedes Benz cars that can hold lots of luggage comfortably; Florian is often doing the night shift; both he and Marco are knowledgeable about Rome and can play concierge very well; Mario and Diana must be two of the nicest people in Italy, and Peter one of the funniest! 4. Rooms - Quite spacious, by European standards, especially in the most-visited cities such as Rome; the tiled bathrooms are evidently newer than the rooms; the shower-stalls are much less cumbersome than slippery bath-tubs elsewhere; some will appreciate that the shower can be hand-held too; shampoo and bath gel in packets are provided; to complete a fine shower experience that the tiled bathrooms seem to be suited for, bring your own cosmetics 5. Other Aspects - a. The reception is one level up from the street. If you have luggage, you could take the quaint elevator/lift. Remember that the elevator doesn't respond to buttons being pressed unless the grill-door is closed. b. At a few times, the hotel can seem noisy, but that's usually only when there are several guests in the breakfast-room. I slept very well every night. c. They do try to offer a free wireless connection to the InterNet, but with a ministry building right across the street, the connection can be flaky. d. Someone is behind the reception-desk at all times; if you return very late in the night to the hotel, ring the doorbell at the street-door 6. Room Charges - Very reasonable; very attractive off-season rates; if you get the super-discounted rates, be prepared to pay by cash (there are ATMs a couple of doors from the hotel); overall, great value for the money; plus, they do accommodate special requests, as for a specific room number/description Hotel Dorica is a great way to stay in comfort, while enjoying wonderful service, and to save some money for other Rome experiences such as food and shopping. It's family-run and the employees take the smooth operation of the hotel seriously. In my view, Dorica is a more charming experience than a chain hotel, without compromise on safety and comfort. Having a solid, metal key to the room is nice by itself. (Remember it's easier to turn it in at the front desk, when you go out.) A genuinely Italian experience in Rome begins at Dorica!

Reviews.Title: “прекрасный город и запоминающийся отдых”
Reviews.Author: elshi
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for 9 days. The Hotel is located in the right plase. We could go sightseeing on foot. The staff at the hotel is very polite. Our a room was comfortable and clean. The staff cleaned it up every day.The room faced a nice.The window of the room gou out on fountain. In the room was a free safe.Stsndart breakfast was offered at the hotel it was useful.We liked the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “nice palce close to "everythig"”
Reviews.Author: dan r
Reviews.Content: The place is very close to Termini station so it made it easy to get from Airport. Staff was very friendly, helped with info and small insides regarding local ways of doing bizz. the room was small but very clean and comfortable. All the important sites were in a 20 minutes walk max, and we even walked to Vatica from there (took us about 1 hour) but you get to see different historical sites on the way so it is nice. widnow view is a plaza but it was not noise or anything. defenetly a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: N V
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel is located in the vicinity of many places of interest and in a short distance from Termini. Friendly, attentive and helpful stuff. Rooms are kept clean and tidy. We recommend this hotel for all who wants to get the good value at rather reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and excellent!”
Reviews.Author: stefin83
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome on our honeymoon in September, and really enjoyed it. The hotel is nice, very clean and it has a good location in the heart of the city. Everybody was very helpful and friendly, just one negative thing, our room was little bit noisy because of the street and traffic. We strongly recommend this family hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good base to discover Rome but...”
Reviews.Author: Knoxy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of termini station and all the sights Rome has to offer. The accommodation is pretty much as I would expect from a 3 star in Italy, rooms were kept spotless and the staff are friendly and very helpful. On the negative side, we found it difficult to sleep with the noise of traffic coming through our second floor window. The breakfast was nice but we would have liked a little bit more of a variety. In saying that, it's hard to please everybody. All in all I would recommend the hotel but beware of the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: amny65
Reviews.Content: Rome hotels are expensive. I paid 140 euros per night for this hotel in early September, which was relatively cheap. I was very happy with the stay. The location is very convenient. There is a bus right cross the street from the hotel that goes to quite a lot of places I wanted to visit. The subway is just a few short blocks away and Termini is also well within walking distance. The hotel is on Piazza del Viminale, right across from the department of internal affairs. The view from my window was very nice. Judging from the exterior of the building, all the hotel’s rooms face the same direction. The immediate surrounding area is quiet but not creepy. There are a lot of places to eat around the hotel. My room was relatively spacious for a European hotel. Furnishing was basic. A free breakfast was included in my room charge. The food was also basic, but plenty and with variety. I believe the hotel is operated by a family. Front desk was friendly and they have a lot of information. Don’t hesitate to ask for recommendations of restaurants, tour routes, etc. They don’t push anything. The breakfast room attendants were very diligent and so was housekeeping. I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “very familial and charming hotel like at home”
Reviews.Author: jojisan
Reviews.Content: The reception was very warm, the room was given before the normal schedule, as soon it was ready, all explanations given in our mother language (french) but also in english, italian.... room was spacious, confortable, clean, nicely decorated, bath room = a shower, toilet and lavabo, the services were ok, breakfast at the italian style (chocolate, capucino, caffe con latte, tea, bread, croissants, fruit juice, jam, cheese..) with a very warm service form the hotel personal. Well placed i the city not far from termini station (5 min walk) all public transport available. the hotel also proposed a appropriate transportation from Airport to hotel and vice a versa at a correct rate. I recommend for a short stay and for visiting Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: advicefromus
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, we walked all over Rome from this Hotel. 5-10 mins walk from Termini station. Nice spacious rooms, cleaned daily. Good clean bathroom. Very impressed with this hotel. Has many floors, but has lift. Opposite government building on a pretty square. Very close to metro station. There's a cafe next to hotel 'cafe viminale'- reasonably priced and great pasta. Carrefour superstore round the corner. Felt very safe in this area even at night. Breakfast- only thing we enjoyed were the hot fresh croissants, otherwise just toast and spreads and juice. Marco from reception very helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Jan J
Reviews.Content: Just 5 minutes walk from St. Maria Magiore, 10 minutes from Colloseum and 5 minutes to Metro station Repubblica – Teatro dell'Opera. Rooms are super clean, quiet, very simple furnished (you will expect little bit more for 3 hotels if you have got some experience from other cities) with free WiFi and comfortable beds. Breakfasts were sufficient, same every day, coffe, tea, juice, some cheese, yogurt and some sweets (no vegetable or eggs). Staff is very polite, friendly and helpful, everybody on reception speaking english. When you consider price, you will hardly find better place to stay if you are comming visit Rome as a tourist, who wanna explore and not spend time in wellness centrum ;) I'm pretty sure that we will booked this hotel for our next trip to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: torontotraveller111
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dorica is very centrally located and you can walk anywhere from here. The breakfast is great and there is a lot of variety to choose from. The room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for city holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jouko P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and staff was very helpful. Air conditioning works very well. Situation was good, few hunred meters from Termini and 100 m to street Nazionale where are buss stops and metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Putnik13
Reviews.Content: Very nice and affordable hotel at excellent location. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean and nicely equiped. Breakfast is better than in other hotels in Italy. Staff at reception was nice and helpfull. Would recommend ii to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel very close to the Termini train station and subway stations. You can even walk to the Trevi Fountain. You are in a quiet and safe street it lies in front of a building of the Italian police. The elevator is an old model very charming and the staff extremely attentive and helpful anytime you need to highlight for Florian who had more contact. The breakfast, included in the daily is served by a waiter (very different service from most hotels in this category). The bedroom and bathroom are spacious and equipped with air conditioning and TV free WiFi and it works! Most overlooking the square in front of the hotel. It is a great choice for those traveling alone or accompanied by family and / or friends. Surely my address every time you visit Rome! Excelente hotel muito próximo da estação de trem Termini e estações de metro. É possível inclusive ir a pé até a Fontana de Trevi. Está em uma rua tranquila e segura pois fica em frente a um prédio da policia italiana. O elevador é um modelo antigo muito charmoso e os funcionários extremamente atenciosos e prestativos a qualquer hora que se precise e aqui destaco Floriano com quem tive mais contato. O café da manhã, incluído na diária é servido por um garçom (serviço bem diferente da maioria dos hotéis dessa categoria). O quarto e o banheiro são espaçosos e equipados com TV ar condicionado e internet WiFi gratuita e que funciona! A maioria com vista para a praça em frente ao hotel. É uma ótima escolha para quem viaja sozinho ou acompanhado pela família e/ou amigos. Com certeza meu endereço sempre que visitar Roma!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good locates”
Reviews.Author: julio s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Dorica for 4 nights, the service is good, rooms cleaned every day with clean towels each time, the hotel is very close from termini hence in 15 min you arrive by walking. the personal was very friendly and helpful every time we needed to find an address or bus to get to any place. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well priced friendly and welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tommie44
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very helpful and informative, they were always available to answer questions or suggest where to visit. The location of the hotel was good, close to the train stations and sites, but not so close as for it to be noisy. The square the hotel was in was beautiful, and had a couple of good restaurants close by. The rooms were a little dated, with older beds, although everything was very well kept and clean. The sit down breakfast was great, and overall would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, highly recommend it to anyone who wants to be in the center, sleep well, eat decent and spend less!”
Reviews.Author: Lucian50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 nights (two mature couples) between 24 and 29 August, although outside was very hot, the hotel central position allowed us to return to the hotel 2-3 hours after lunch to rest and resume the program after rest. Large room, the bathroom also, air conditioning OK, enough breakfast (even the same each morning), the staff led by Marco very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff makes up for small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms was very small, it was fully equipped (and with both a roof fan and an air-condition unit for the heat) and very close to the historic centre monuments. But most of all, it was the excellent staff that made the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pippa015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited rome for a couple of days at the end of June. We were keen to find somewhere to stay that was clean, pleasant, in a good location, friendly and not too expensive and hotel Dorica provided just that! We arrived and were met by Marcos, who showed us to our room, spacious, clean airy and with a stunning view over the square. He was very helpful on advising us on places to go and eat and made our stay as easy as it could be. The thing we liked best about this hotel was that we were able to walk to all of the places that we wanted to visit. In our 3 days there I think we took the bus once! It was very easy to get to and from the airport, being only 10 mins walk from the station with direct trains (30 mins) to the airport. There were also lovely restaurants around the hotel and an excellent gelateria where we ate in the evenings. Overall I would throroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a few days in Rome in an excellent location, in a hotel which will not break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: l_wolfs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the center of Rome; about 500 metres from central station Termini and about 300 metres from metrostation Republicca. Despite being in the center of Rome, it is very quiet in and around the hotel. The hotel staff is perfect; they are always friendly and helpful; especially Marco. He is always there to help you. The room and breakfast are good too. Next time we're in Rome, we will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mamog
Reviews.Content: Dorica is a great little hotel with "no frills". We liked that everything works, from AC to bathroom/shower. Our room was comfortable and clean. Fre WiFi also worked very well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We walked from Termini to the Hotel. Took us less then 10 minutes. If you turn right when you walk out of the Hotel and walk straight ahead for 12-15 minutes, you will be on top of the Spanish Steps! Turn left and walk for 2 minutes and you will be in front of the Santa Maria Maggiore, one of the really old churches in Rome. Hotel Dorica has a really good location and gives you great value for money. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Polecam hotel: miła obsluga, dobry standard”
Reviews.Author: Emilia27814
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, stuff is nice, good standard and excellent location, next to centre and station termini, it is very good start point to see all Rome. Emilia

Reviews.Title: “Will choose this hotel if we revisit Rome”
Reviews.Author: Aqua37
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 4 and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to a cruise from Civitavecchia. The hotel is very central, just 7 minutes away from Termini. The staff is very helpful and friendly and they communicate very well even in English. The breakfast they offer is excellent, the room was comfortable and always spotless. We recommend this hotel both for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “We`ll be back!”
Reviews.Author: leana3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay, very good location and the staff is very friendly and helpful especially Marco and Florian. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, perfect service, good location in the centre of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: edelamer
Reviews.Content: We (family wit 2 children) stayed here for 1 night. The hotel is at walking distance of al major sightseeings and the Roma termini rail station. Nice clean room (working airco!), good breakfast, very friendly staff. When picking up our luggage after the 2nd day walking around Rome we were offered to freshen up before we took off to the station. Our next trip to Rome we will stay at hotel Dorica again. Mille Grazie !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, where we will return”
Reviews.Author: Jarka23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dorica is satisfactory in every way - comfortable, clean, staff very friendly, willing to provide other ancillary services such as luggage storage, taxi to the airport, excursions ... Breakfast and service were great. We felt very well here. The hotel is ideally located in the historic center of Rome within walking distance of famous landmarks. Located on a small, relatively quiet and nice square with a fountain. Visitors to Rome recommended him as a very pleasant environment to which I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: TravelNelson
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, Clean and quiet room close to Termini. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: geertenann
Reviews.Content: good situated in the city of Rome, good and friendly personel, especially the boy(18yo) who served the breakfast and the desk, also we get good information of Marco. Bathrooms are a bit small, breakfast till 9 is early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: LucyCoquitlam
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay at the Hotel Dorica before boarding a ship for the Med. cruise and then one night after our return. It is in the perfect location. We were able to walk to many of the famous landmarks - Trevi Fountain, Colleseum, Forum, etc. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is perfect - the biggest and best doughnut we've ever had. Also, they will make a special coffee drink if you wish. Ask for the Bomb. They made various arrangements for us - directions to the HopOnHopOff bus, transfer to the ship, night tour of Rome, transfer to the airport. On arriving in Rome we chose to go from the airport to the main train station by train. This was fine but the train stops a long way from the main entrance to the station - about 15-20 minutes to walk to the entrance. From the main entrance it was another 15 minute walk to the Hotel. Not too bad but travelling by taxi back to the airport was a better choice. The rooms are very clean and the bed is comfortable - very necessary after walking all day. We would certainly tell our friends about the Hotel Dorica and we would stay there again if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Hande35
Reviews.Content: We booked online and Marco arranged us a car from the FCO airport. We arrived late but the staff was great. The rooms are spacious with high ceilings. Light and very clean. The location is good. Walking distance to central historical places. You can also take the bus or metro if you are tired. The breakfast was great. A lot to eat with bread, cheese etc. The staff is great. Marco and Florian, very polite and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everybody and will definitely stay here if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: slade2001
Reviews.Content: We choose Dorica Hotel for three nights in Rome. Classic Hotel, very reasonable for the price.Very familiar and likely staff. Placed very good to acess the metro or walking to every historical sites . View to Viminale Place very nice and quiet. Cozy rooms and bathrooms. Florian, the receptionist was very close to answer to every question about everything. The Italian Breakfast (they call it collazione) in the morning helps us to discover Rome full of energy.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, affordable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler242424
Reviews.Content: Everyone bent over backwards to help us as this was our first time in Italy. We felt very welcome. The room was comfortable, but I wouldn't describe it as fancy. The location was within walking distance of all the sights of Rome. The breakfast every morning was good but may not fill up someone with a hearty appetite. The best thing about the hotel was the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Vindu123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dorica for two nights - Great Hotel, very reasonable for the price. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Based in a very convenient locality. View outside the room was great. Sleeping at night was not a problem, eventhought the hotel faces a busy road. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Great room service. Finding the hotel was a bit of a hassel as the nameboard is small. But if you are lucky enough to locate it, you will surely LOVE the stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ERAN_Colombo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dorica service went beyond our expectations. The staff throughout the hotel, starting from the reception, the café etc, was so friendly, we felt as if we were at home. We were also taught a little bit of Italian as well. Room had all the necessities, however no mini cooler, but spacious and had a really nice view of the Piazza del Viminale. The hotel is located very strategically near the rome termini and the surrounding area also provide a wide range of choices for restaurants, from Indian, Lebanese, Chinese and of course Italian. Most restaurants located in the same street are quite cheap and the food was found to be really good. The hotel is also located near a lot of shops and delis from which you can do all you’re shopping. Vast array of transportation available in close proximity. Bus stop is located right infront of the hotel. I believe bus 71 and 70 both stop at this point. And ofcourse it’s a 5 min max walk from the rome termini station where you find the trains and metro. Its really close to Via Nationale, which made it easy for shopping. 15min walk will take you right to trevi fountain and the surrounding area for sightseeing. Hotel room, bath was also really clean and had hot water which was really required after a day of walking. They serve a very light yet filling breakfast to kick start the day. The hotel and its rooms were all in all very clean and have a very welcoming ambiance. The front desk is always open and we found this to be very good as we went out at night for the night tours and got late to come in. The hotel staff is very friendly and provides all the help and guidance to make your stay in Italy truly unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Location and helpfull staff, I´ll be back!”
Reviews.Author: minnatre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Dorica last weekend and probably will stay there many more times in the future. 1. Location. Very close to everything, but not in the noisiest street. We had no problem to sleep at night even though our room was towards the street. Shops, restaurants and major tourist sites are very near and you can walk most of them. From the Via Nazionale (busy shopping street very close to the hotel) you can take the bus to the Vatican and other parts of the city if you need. Very safe area too which is very important to us when choosing a hotel in any major city. 2. Very clean. And this is something we always pay our special attention to, because we run our own cleaning company:-). It was probably the most spotless hotel room I've ever been. 3. Rooms. I've been in Rome few times before and stayed in 4*hotels, but this was the biggest room I've ever been there. We also had a little balcony and a great view of the fountain in front of the hotel. 4. Staff. Very friendly and helpfull. We needed a lot of help when one of us got very sick and the staff did everything they could to help us in the situation. They also give you a lot of tips for good restaurants, shopping streets etc. 5.Breakfast. Basic, but good, enough for us. Coffee was great and the guy who served it was always smiling and cheerfull. Overall, the hotel doesn't look fancy outside and there is no huge lobby area, but everything works great, they help you with everything, location is superb and rooms are big and clean. These were the things we wanted from our hotel and this one had them all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bulinutze
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great position, perfect for visiting the city. We received a very appreciate help from the staff, lot of tips :) Many thanks!!!!! Andreea

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AntonioBelo
Reviews.Content: The staff is very nice. Altough it's not a brillant hotel it has good relation between price and conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - we will come back here”
Reviews.Author: suree
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms with modern bathrooms with good working showers (a plus in Rome from places we've stayed before) good breakfast and very friendly staff and the dog! Great Location for sightseeing and arriving to the main Termini station - 10 min walk away. It is admittedly on a busy road, but this is Rome and actually although very noisy in the daytime I slept well as it was much quieter and I'm not the best at sleeping through noise living in the countryside as we do. Aircon and fan in the room were a bonus as the weather was pretty hot the week we went. Luckily an afternoon nap meant we were up and about for walks to some wonderful restaurants especially Il Chianti not far from the Trevi fountain only a nice 20 min stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: lgernon
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Mam stayed in Hotel Dorica last weekend and we loved it. The staff were so friendly and helpful. We were greeted by Marco when we arrived and he did everything to make us feel at home. I did not catch the names of the other staff but every time we came in and out we were greeted with a smile. We got some great recommendations from them for restaurants, advise on how to take the local bus etc. The breakfast was great and you only had to ask for a second helping. The room was nice nothing fancy, comfy bed, wardrobe, it was spotless and the pressure in the shower was fab and just what you needed after a day walking around Rome, which was one of the most beautiful cities I have had the pleasure to visit. The location was great 10 minute walk from the main train station, felt very safe at night walking around. If you are a pizza fan, ask Marco to direct you to the little pizza takeaway around the corner from the hotel AMAZING!!! There is a safe in the room that is free to use and a hair dryer in the bathroom. My only advise would be to bring ear plugs as the noise from the traffic outside can be a little noisy otherwise I would HIGHLY recommend staying here. I hope to come back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Rocio_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days in which the hotel staff, specially Marco whom speaks Italian, English and Spanish, went the extra mile to assist us with directions and suggestions to go about in town. The continental breakfast was more than enough to get you through the morning. Loved the capuccinos made by a very friendly lady ( I never asked for her name). She's always smiling and willing to offer her delicious capuccinos. Mario is great and caters to your breakfast needs every morning with a welcoming Buongiorno!. The young waiter we met later in our stay is also very friendly (Sorry, I never got his name as well). The front desk also assists you with tour reservations. The rooms were small and modest, but extremely clean. This hotel is in a great location to catch the bus, train or taxi...actually is centrally located to explore the city on foot as I and my two teenagers did. We only took the train once to be on time for our tour session. The hotel is in a very safe location since it's right across Ministero dell'Interno. So it's very safe day and night. My best regards to everyone at Hotel Dorica.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel. Exceptionally friendly”
Reviews.Author: IJBLondon
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay at the Dorica. Great location. Desk staff were really kind and helpful, and nothing was too much trouble. The whole place was exceptionally clean. The rooms were fine - not luxurious but perfectly reasonable for this price range. Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good mid-range option in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location - but check carefully what you have booked”
Reviews.Author: NeilSRobin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Dorica for a week's holiday in Rome. Good Points: 1. This is a family-run hotel and the staff are extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. Their recommendations for places to eat were excellent, and their advice on travelling in Rome was also extremely useful. They even allowed us to leave our luggage in a secure room at the hotel on our last day after checking out, as our flight home was not until the evening. 2. The breakfast is superb. The same things are provided each day but there is sufficient variety (inc. rolls, pastries, yoghurt, cereal, cheese) that it does not become boring. We looked forward to it every morning. 3. The location is perfect for exploring the centre of Rome, particularly if you are looking to visit ancient Rome (the Colosseum etc) or Christian Rome (the Vatican etc). It is within easy walking distance of Rome's central railway station (Termini) from which you can ride the Metro around the city centre or take mainline trains further out. There are also plenty of bus services but we didn't make use of them. I wouldn't recommend trying to park a car here, or anywhere in Rome city centre for that matter. 4. The room was very clean, comfortable and warm, ideal for coming back to after a day walking around the city. There was a shower in our bathroom but no bath, though this was not a problem for us. 5. We were able to book 7 nights for the price of 6 which made our holiday a little cheaper than anticipated! Bad Points: 1. When we made the booking, we were told by the online service that it included a free pickup service to/from the airport. When I contacted the hotel to arrange when and where this would take place, I was told it was no longer available, but no reason was given for this change. Fortunately it is possible to get a direct nonstop train (for 14 euros per person) from Fiumicino airport to Rome's central station (Termini) and then the hotel is within easy walking distance. 2. At the same time as finding about about the airport pickup no longer being available, I was also informed our booking hadn't been completed due to an error made while filling it in online. The error was rectified and the booking made, but we had not been told about it despite making the booking weeks in advance. If I hadn't contacted the hotel to ask about the airport pickup, we could conceivably have arrived thinking our booking had been completed, when it hadn't. 3. Noise level can be a problem for light sleepers, either from adjoining rooms or from the street outside. In fairness there isn't much they can do about this, and if you want peace and quiet on holiday then you are unlikely to be going to the centre of Rome anyway. In summary: this is a lovely hotel with a great location which I would instantly recommend - but be very careful to confirm that your booking has gone through and what exactly it includes!

Reviews.Title: “Charming place”
Reviews.Author: NYCnative76
Reviews.Content: I had made a booking here last minute as I'd changed plans and needed to come in a day earlier. The price was average for Rome but pricey at 99 euros for a solo traveler. With that being said, the room was huge and the bathroom was nice and big too. Could've easily had someone stay with me. The staff was super friendly and accommodating-- I felt like I was staying with family. The breakfast was my only complaint. It was super basic-- just pastries and yogurt, but I guess that's a normal Italian thing. I'd definitely recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dorica - Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: guitar12
Reviews.Content: Convenient, courteous, clean, comfortable, charming. Translate into any language and you are describing HOTEL DORICA, its owner and staff. We stayed here (10 days) in September and highly, recommend this family-owned hotel with multi-linqual staff and incredible breakfasts. Quiet, great location and wonderful staff; you will absolutely love it! We did!

Reviews.Title: “A magical mystery tour”
Reviews.Author: Minnie2610
Reviews.Content: We were doubled booked because of a U2 concert. Were moved across the city to an apartment, met by a large tatooed man who showed us to an apartment, which we were to be sharing with 3 other couples. There was one bathroom between eight, a kitchen to make your own breakfast, only there wasn't anything on offer. The other guests were very noisy, banging the door to come in at 1:30 am because someone has locked the door!! We stayed one night then had to make our own way back to the Dorica. The owner wanted to charge us the full price - he eventually agreed not to charge for breakfast a whole 20 euros. He said because he could have charged much more for the room and because he had paid for the taxi to the apartment there was no apology at all. It was quite scary to be ferried across the city not knowing where we were going to end up. The hotel certainly made a handsome profit from our misery. It was a shame because the hotel staff were helpful and appeared sorry that the owner had treated us so badly. Wouldn't risk staying there again as other review sites show that this isn't the first time they have doubled booked guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but very poor accommodation and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Toni14_10
Reviews.Content: The Dorica Hotel is in a great location; walking distance from the Stazione di Roma Termini and central to tourist attractions. Other than that, I would not recommend. The word 'cell' would more accurately describe the room we were given. It was pokey, with hardly room to pass each other to collect clothes from the wardrobe, which was so close to the bed that there was no room for a bedside table. The toilet and wash basin were in a very small room, separate from the frosted glass, walk-in shower cubicle. The room was dark and dingey, with no natural sunlight , as the window was shuttered, adding to the feeling of claustrophobia. The room was extremely hot, as the air conditioning, although noisy, didn't appear to be working - it was hotter in the room than outside. Breakfast was the same each morning, consisting of a ready laid plate of bread roll, packeted processed cheese, packeted cream cheese, yogurt and semi stale croissant / doughnut. The cappucino was good.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience we had during our trip in Italy”
Reviews.Author: HeziNaor
Reviews.Content: I can't describe by words the service and patience of the staff. All of them were very friendly and helped us in any issue. The hotel location is fantastic! The room is comfortable! Special thanks to Peter, Marco, and Florian. This is my only hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “they treated us as family”
Reviews.Author: MARWANBeirut
Reviews.Content: The staff at hotel dorica were very cooperative. They treated us as family. In fact, they pointed the top touristic tips, advised on what to buy, shared our problem with the air strike. I MUST THANK THEM FOR THE COMFORT THEY PROVIDED ME ESPECIALLY MARCO, FLORIAN & Mr. PIETRO. I RECOMMEND HOTEL DORICA ALSO FOR BEING IN THE MIDDLE OF ALL TOURISTIC SCENES AND CLOSE TO THE TRAIN TERMINI. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: JoseMarcos
Reviews.Content: Close to attractions, clean, very helpful staff, great breakfast includes fresh fruit. Couldn't be better a way to get around central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: verde99
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Dorica Rome with my famiglia.stupenda tourist area in the center of Rome opposite the Home Affairs Ministry. spacious room overlooking the square with all the excellent confort.staff always available to make you feel at agio.breakfast fabulous with fresh croissants and coffee very good.

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: jacquituk
Reviews.Content: just come back from a 3 night stay at the dorica. good value for money, easily within walking distance of all the major sites. i stayed with my brother, we were a bit dismayed to find a double bed when we had specified twin, however this was easily solved by pulling the beds apart! staff very friendly and helpful. we had a room at the front overlooking the piazza which is beautiful. would have liked a kettle in the room to be able to make a cup of tea after a day of sightseeing. the only complaint would be that the battery on our safe went and could not be replaced until the following morning, luckily we had enough money on us to be able to eat that night! overall, a decent, very clean, good value hotel. i would definetly recommend it and would use it again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: dashal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dorica for a week in April (pre volcanic ash!!). Well located and close enough to Termini to walk, but far enough away so as not to be feeling dodgy like around termini. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are fine too. Breakfast is nice, and substantial for a day of sightseeing! We had a room at the front that overlooks the Piazza which is lovely. Very close to the Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. Walking distance to Vatican in 25 mins, or very close to Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, welcoming and clean!”
Reviews.Author: bostonfelicita
Reviews.Content: As the director of study abroad programs for university students in Rome, I find the Hotel Dorica the ideal place for large groups of foreign students. The hotel is centrally located and close to all touristic attractions, bus/metro stops and Termini station. The rooms are spacious, airy, full of light, and very clean. The staff is incredibly kind and estremely helpful. Students get easily sick in the winter, but the staff offered a cup of hot tea to whoever needed it in a cold or wet day. The hotel is safe, the staff welcoming, the atmosphere cozy. When staying in Rome for about 3 weeks, the hotel becomes like home and the staff like family. I thank the people at the Dorica who took very good care of us while we where there this past January.

Reviews.Title: “What a miserable hotel experience - the owner from hell”
Reviews.Author: Lucia207
Reviews.Content: Noisy, noisy, and noisy. Terrible mattress. Lacking amenities. Stayed there with a group, and was in the large room between the dining room and the owner's office, overlooking the piazza. The noise from the street was apparent even with the windows/shades shut, so I wore earplugs every night. But the earplugs did not drown out the noise the owner made – I always knew when he was around, as he didn’t talk, he yelled. Loudly. Continually. His loud voice was what I heard first thing early every morning – through the earplugs! And if he was having an argument with his wife, who was at the hotel frequently, and they were frequently arguing, the noise was on par with a jack hammer that didn’t cease. The guy barely came up for air on one afternoon-long argument. Unfortunately I had to do a lot of paperwork while in Rome, so was in the room often and rarely had quiet. After several days, I asked him to lower his voice in the hallway, and he began yelling at me! And then the rest of my stay, he would barely look at me nor would he serve me breakfast in the dining room. He obviously does not like people telling him what to do in his own hotel. But he did stop pawing me after this. However, my feeling is that they advertise the place as “quiet and serene” which it was definitely NOT whenever the owner was in! My mattress, a double bed, was unbearably uncomfortable. Hard, lumpy, and covered with a RUBBER sheet directly under the linens (unbelievable!), it was the worst bed I’ve ever slept on in Italy (and that includes when I was a starving student in dive hotels). The mattress had to be about 30 years old. I asked the owner’s son, who also works at the hotel, for a blanket to put under me and got a little lecture about how good a hard mattress is. He would only give me one very old small blanket, saying he couldn’t find any other. The next day another worker in the hotel found several thick blankets in the same closet for me. With two blankets folded in half under me, the bed was bearable for the rest of my stay. But a mattress pad is needed, if not a new mattress, for any comfort. The room is equipped with glaring florescent reading lights attached to the walls next to the bed and overhead. There is no light for the desk. There is no bureau, but a built in armoire with a couple of hangers. The safe in the room never worked. The smell of cigarette smoke was frequently in my room, which came from the wife, who would smoke in the dining room under the 'Vietato Fumare' sign. Other than smoking in the non smoking hotel, she was a very pleasant person who was always gracious. The internet was spotty the first fews days and then went out for days, no connection. The good points about the hotel: the two room cleaners, Mario and Diana, are so nice, so efficient and so sweet that when they were around, and the owner wasn't, it was a lovely place. The shower in the room’s very clean bathroom was strong and always had hot water. The rooms are larger than many I've seen in Italy and the ones overlooking the piazza are bright and sunny. The hotel is right near Via Nazionale, where it was easy to pick up a bus to sites. But I will remember this hotel with dismay, and now appreciate my own bed so so much more than ever before!

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: canatrav
Reviews.Content: The sine qua non of the host industry is the honouring of confirmed reservations. On our second visit to the Dorica the owner admitted that he had overbooked our last night there, but hoped to get a last-minute cancellation He did not. Instead we were taken to the most depressing hotel we have ever stayed at (the Michigan). Admittedly, the Dorica is good value and conveniently located, but they dumped us to save turning down a 3-night reservation. If you can't rely on your confirmation, the rest means nothing. There are dozens of hotels in this area (west of P. Republica and Sta. Maria Maggiore), far more than the internet leads one to believe. No need to gamble on the Dorica.

Reviews.Title: “Never book it!”
Reviews.Author: mira20
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in Hotel Dorica via booking.com. But when we arrived an owner of the hotel said that it is not interesting and enough profitable for him to give a room for 1 night and he will not do it. Absolutely unnormal situation! We had to live in awful place for unreasonable price because it was impossible to find something better in Rome on May, 1. So never book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel in good location with friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: Bembridge1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the beginning of April. Hotel location is excellent, close to Termini station, but far enough away to not be a "station hotel" with all that comes with that. Quite safe, opposite the Ministry of Interior, but since this is in a nice Palazzo, with a nice fountain, you don't notice. Peter ( the proprietor) is very friendly, and you can be chatty or quiet, and he will respond helpfully. Breakfast is enough, with great Roman coffee. Ask Peter to tell you his excellent joke about how to catch a monkey. Rooms clean and always made up well. We woukd come again, especially for the great location - quiet but very central for buses, metro or walking to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Dorica understands what's important”
Reviews.Author: AverageTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dorica has everything that can make a stay in Rome comfortable. The owner, Peter, is friendly, helpful and efficient. He understands the off-season. The hotel offers great rates at the moment. A double room for 75 Euro a night is a steal. Rooms 23 and 24 share a small courtyard at the back and are ideal for smokers. The rooms have double-paned windows and so even the street-facing rooms are quiet. The decor may be generic, but the rooms are more spacious than an average room in Europe (where sometimes there's room for one suitcase at best, apart from the guest). The bathrooms look new. Apart from minor things like body lotion, I can't think of anything that was missing. Peter, originally from Ancona on the eastern coast of Italy, has visited NY and SF several times. He's worldly-wise and funny. He and his daughter, Emmanuella, run a very efficient hotel. The breakfast is good, although not elaborate, but the service ensures you have a good start to your morning. There's an alternative in the Gran Caffe Piacente, next door, which opens at 6 a.m. You could also go there for a drink in the evening - munchies are free. Most sightseeing spots are walkable from Piazza Viminale. You may need to take the metro to go to the Vatican, and there are two Metro stations - Repubblica and Termini - that are close to Viminale. A cab ride to, say Piazza Navona, costs single-digit euros. Another plus is that the shops in this area are not tourist-traps. Dorica concentrates on the basics and gets them right. Therefore, it is very good value, one of the best I've seen in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly family hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Wildschwein
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located half way between the Colusseum and the Spanish steps. All other major sights are also in walking distance. The hotel is run by an Italian couple who made us (2 adults and 2 children aged 7 and 10) feel very welcome and at home. The hotel is clean and everything worked (including the air conditioning). The owners as well as the staff were very helpful. The breakfast is basic but ok. This is a hotel suitable for young families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: gsoin
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in May. The best part of this hotel is it's proximity to all the major sites in Rome. It is also close to some very fine restaurants. The Termini station is only a few minutes walk from the hotel. The owner of the hotel was very kind to help us make a reservation in Firenze. I definitely recommend this property. Do not forget to ask for the special honeymoon rate and you will receive a surprise gift.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but spotless and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Greenandwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect for sightseeing, within walking distance of Colosseum, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Vittorio Emaneule Monument and Piazza Navona. Very good selection of restaurants and Bars nearby. Metro/trains and buses 7/8 minute walk with a Supermarket 2 minutes around the corner. The Hotel is basic but it is spotlessly clean. Our room was a good size with a very comfortable bed, great shower and lovely view over Piazza. The hotel Staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definately recommend this Hotel and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: SemiLOOSE
Reviews.Content: this is a nice little hotel, stayed two nights here, we were budget travellers so we expected worst and were pleasently surprised. the guy at the reception was cool, very helpfull, he drew on the map and told us how to get to places. the room was a straight forward room, nothing fancy, booked a tripe room, got three beds, room and bathroom were very clean. had a safety box in the cabinet, kept all the stuff there, no problem. we were using the hotel just to sleep so all we cared about was the bed and clean bathroom. breakfast...just ignore it, have a tea/coffee if you want, other than that i wouldnt touch anything on the plate, go outside and eat! not really complaining about the breakfast, we booked cheap and breakfast was cheap as you would expect. the location is what this hotel is all about, right close to the roma termini and republicca metro station, what else do u need? from here you can see the whole of rome in 2 days... thats what we did :-). easy to get to hotel via taxi even if you dont know any italian, all taxis know piazza di viminale...so u dont have to show them maps point fingers

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Dump !”
Reviews.Author: Pippa/David
Reviews.Content: As with everything else in Rome (like the Sistine Chapel) book way in advance to avoid disappointment. We booked this hotel at short notice and were disappointed. 15 minutes walk from Spanish steps along a busy road, rooms very small, basic and not very clean. One room was decorated like a jungle with just a small window out on to the laundry/cleaning supplies ! Breakfast basic - a slice of stale cake, rolls and a yoghurt, not buffet just set at the table each day. If booking direct with hotel you must pay at end of stay in cash - very overpriced for what you get.. Do not spoil your trip to this wonderful city by staying here !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: MiguelD
Reviews.Content: We booked by mail and you receive a confirmation mail few hours later. When you arrived, the service was performant and the room (included bathroom) was very clean, with a good dimension, etc... The hotel is in the centre of Roma and you can visit the historic town by foot. We had just take bus to go to Vatican, but it's easy to go by foot in ~40 minuts. It's a great place and when we'll go to Roma, we'll go to this hotel ! M. Dhyne, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Not reliable, they cancelled an already CONFIRMED reservation on us”
Reviews.Author: pal0ma
Reviews.Content: Good we checked email before leaving for Rome. After sending us a confirmation of our reservation they sent us another email cancelling our reservation without any explanation. We were left to scramble to find an hotel at the last minute. They never replied to our email. I would not trust this place.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: PNW
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel with no frills, but we found it much better than hotels we'd stayed in a few blocks closer to the train station. The rooms are small but fine to sleep in, the plumbing is fine and the air conditioning was not strong but did help. The breakfast is adequate though certainly not cheerful. As previous reviewers noted, the real beauty is the location. Walkable to many sights, and an easy 10 minutes to Termini. It felt safe and quiet at night. Our stay was short so we wanted something near the train station. For a longer stay I'd recommend trying to find something near Piazza Navona or Campo dei Fiori--it's great being in the heart of the historic center for evening passegiata. We also were caught off guard by the cash-only requirement. I took another look at the website later, and the special deal did mention it--though we didn't realize we were booking that way.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, not for an enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: ManYoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in July and was very dissapointed, room was basic and very very dark and badly air conditioned, the only positive was a big bathroom! The breakfasts were a joke and were made up of pre-packed breads and weird juices that all came on the same plate, its in a good location but that about all!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel within walking distance to sights”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi08
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits on a nice square opposite police headquarters. The room was clean. There was a safe deposit box to leave valuables in. You could walk to a lot of sights and it is handy to metro stations and taxi ranks. There were a lot of good restaurants nearby and an amazing gelato place on Via Nazionale. The curtains were great - complete black out and it was so quiet we slept in until 10am one day! A little strange that there were no power points to charge cameras etc, you had to use the bathroom shaving power point. No iron for ironing mens shirts in order to look smart at night either.

Reviews.Title: “small, clean, 2.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: dugan131
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for the price; I paid 145 euro for a single. The location is within walking distance of the center of rome and is great if you arrive my train. The rooms are small and clean and they have safes and the personel were helpful. If you book here, you might want to get a room that is not overlooking the street; they are much quiter. Please be aware that the wireless internet access they advertise is slow that it's almost completely useless. I booked directly through the hotel website and the problem was that when you arrive they will tell you that since you booked through the website you need to pay in cash, no credit cards. This caught me and a few others by surprise because they never mentioned this when I was booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chick5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dorica for 4 nights based on reviews from this site. I'm really glad that I stayed there. Although it was a bit more expensive than I wanted (130 Euros per night in high season for a single ), it was definitely worth the money. Cleanliness, location, and staff - all fabulous. Room: The room was a small single (maybe 6'X8' at most; the high ceilings helped make it feel not so confining) but it was immaculate - totally clean and neat - and it was a welcome haven at the end of a long day. The mattress was firm but comfortable, and I slept really well. I would really recommend that you try to get a room away from the elevator or the entryway. People coming in and out from the elevator and the sound of the door shutting got old fast. Overall, though, the hotel was very quiet. I never heard anyone else in any of the actual rooms around me. Sites: The beauty of the Dorica is its location: I was able walk to the Termini train station, the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, the Colloseum, and the Forum within 15 -20 minutes. The best tip I got was this: Take the metro to St. Peter's and climb the dome early in the morning while you're still fresh, THEN go to the Vatican museum later after lunch, when the crowds lessen. I arrived at St. Peter's at 8:15 and got in in 15 minutes. I climbed the dome first, then walked around the basilica. Afterwards, I went and had a nice, early lunch a few blocks up. At noon, I went back to the Vatican, and the line to get in was half the size it was in the morning. I got into the Vatican in 20 minutes. Shopping: If you like shopping, you're right next to the Via Nazionale. If you walk out of the hotel and turn right, you'll hit Via Nazionale one block up. Then turn left on Via Nazionale, and there are tons of clothing stores and shoe stores. Internet: Walk out of the hotel and turn right until you hit Via Nazionale. Turn right at Via Nazionale, then walk 2 blocks to Via Napoli . Turn right at Via Napoli, and you'll find an internet cafe (behind the Irish pub). They don't really seem to have internet access at the hotel for guests except for emergencies (from what I could tell) so this cafe was great. Snack Food: Walk out of hotel, go right until you come to Via Nazionale. Go right on Via Nazionale. Walk 2 blocks up to Via Firenze, and there's a guy on the corner on the right hand side with a fruit stand who sells fruit, water, soda, beer, and snacks. He was there every evening too. Supermarket: Walk out of the hotel and go left, then turn left at Via del Viminale. You'll find a supermarket on the left. (It's literally right around the corner, but it's mostly underground - Check with Gianni about the street name for this one). Restaurants: When you walk out of the hotel, you'll see the Via Palermo on the right hand side. Down that street are little shops with yogurt, fruit , and slices of pizza. If you keep walking down that street about 5 blocks, you'll come to a cool little street called Via del Boschetto. There's a little market there and dozens of inexpensive, romantic restaurants. Staff: Gianni/John and Antonio, the clerks at the hotel were extremely helpful with suggesting places to go to dinner (Pasta Love, for example), for gifts, great gelati, and itineraries. It was great talking to them every evening when I returned from a long day. Super helpful, and both speak English. Breakfast: The same every day, yes, but it was enough to get me going in the morning. Killer cappuccino too. Tip: wait for the woman to come to you to serve you. Don't try to get up and get anything yourself. :) One last thing - I am a woman in my early 30's, and was traveling alone. I was felt totally safe walking around alone, sometimes even in the late evening (after about 9:30pm or so, though, I would say have it's best to have someone with you because it can be a bit dark. Just keep your wits about you). Overall , I would definitely stay there again! Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have returned from 6 days in Rome staying at Hotel Dorica. We arrived late at night but this was not a problem, the guy on the desk was expecting us and had everything ready for us inc maps and information. Room was perfectly fine, very clean. We had a Piazza facing room, traffic noise was not too bad, the loudest sound was of the fountain opposite. We didn't eat there so can't comment but the staff were really friendly and helpful, very informative and chatty. Location is excellent - walking distance from many attractions but also close to Metro for Vatican (Repubblica Station). It is reasonably close to Termini Station but away from the less appealing aspects. Next to National Theatre and Opera and Govt buildings so quite upmarket. We never felt anything other than safe and secure walking around at night. Restaurant in the Piazza opposite is good and it is nice to sit there around 6-7 as it starts to get cooler around sunset. Rome is a fantastic city and the Hotel Dorica an excellent base from which to explore. It is a good value for money, 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel Dorica is an excellent place to stay when in Rome.It's clean the management is great and very helpful,they all speak english and any question asked,they try there upmost to help you!!!!.The Dorica is in the heart of the centre of Rome,great location for shopping and it goes without saying!!! it's close to all the magnificent historic buildings that makes this city one of the the most beautiful cities of the world.If you are planing a trip to Rome,I wouldn't esitate to sugest to stay at Dorica.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Orione_itaca
Reviews.Content: it was great to stay at dorica,clean and the managment was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with street noise”
Reviews.Author: ZoomLady
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay here in October 2005 after desperately trying to find accommodations in Rome at the last minute. Book ahead in Rome by at least a few weeks! Hotel Dorica is clean and efficiently run by a friendly family. Many of the rooms face the Defense Ministry (pretty building and fountain, making the area safe, too), but the street out front is very busy at all hours of the day and night, making it difficult to sleep. We almost laughed when we got the breakfast: everything was pre-packaged, wrapped in plastic, served with watered down juice. Up until that point in our 2-month trip we'd had better breakfasts at cheaper hotels and pensions. We'll not be staying there again, especially since there are similar hotels nearby that have the same rates with quieter rooms and better breakfasts (Hotel Oceania, for example).

Reviews.Title: “clean place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Charles02138
Reviews.Content: It's about a 15-20 min walk to the attractions. So if the weather is good then you can certainly walk to everywhere. I don't know how large hotel rooms in Europe usually are. But this one has small rooms and bathrooms. This place is very clean and if you are out sightseeing all day and just use this hotel to sleep then it's no big deal. The free breakfast buffet is OK. The surroundings is nice. Relatively close to the train station but not too close to be concerned. The front desk is generally helpful. Johnny in particular is nice. Others will also do what you ask of them. Yes, there's many americans who stayed there. I think the owners joke about us in italians.

Reviews.Title: “Dorica is OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont come here expecting the Bellagio. Its an older hotel located about a 15 min. walk from Termini station. Its a 20-30 min. walk to the colloseum and about the same or a little more to the Spanish Steps. Breakfast is some bread, various packaged goods, and coffee(really good capuccino) or juice (like Tang). Room was small (typical of many hotels in Rome), AC worked very well, bathroom was pretty clean with the exception of some mildew buildup in the tile grout (yeah...my review is pretty thorough). Bed was pretty hard, kind of like sleeping on granite. Try to get a room that isnt street side and you should be able to get a decent nights sleep though -pretty easy to do in Rome since you walk miles each day. Staff here were very nice and helpful. Hotel is in a decent area and walking around at night is not a problem. Would consider staying again if I got a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “If you're American, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: galaban
Reviews.Content: This hotel, really, isn't that bad. But if you're used to American hotels, run! We could get past the ugly entire-wall picture, the lights that only turn on when you have the key in the slot, the rock-hard bed, and even the window that looked out into the laundry room. However, the slobber on the pillows, the strange shower that was made out of a closet, and the lack of a sense of security really earned the Terrible rating for this hotel. You'll find some websites that rate this as a 3-star and some as a 2-star. This truly is a 2-star hotel. If it weren't for the toilet and shower-closet in the room, I'd even question that. Although you'll pay a bit more money, try Hotel Napoleon. It's a much, much better deal. I will say this, if you do get this hotel, the restaurant across the street is fabulous and the square across the street is also a great place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we found in Europe”
Reviews.Author: KarlottaMargarita
Reviews.Content: At the end of 5 weeks in Europe we decided to stay in this hotel. What a bad idea. The shower/bath flooded the bathroom, bathroom was not that clean as well and the bed was a bit dodgy just sitting on it. We decided to check out and try our luck elsewhere (and paid for the whole night despite being there only 2 hours) When we tried to explain to the manager/owner nicely why, he became verbally abusive and aggressive. Compared to the other 3 star hotels we stayed in in France, Spain and Italy, this was definty the worst and neither my wife or myself have ever been treated this way by a hotel. Found another 3 star hotel which was 30 euro a night cheaper and twice as good just around the corner. Hotel Dorica, never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Hahahah cool hotel... Gianni really does rock! lol”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: okay so for a 3 star hotel... its good! its clean... cleaning ladies dont come in when your there even if your in your room till 11... i didnt eat in the hotel...! so cant comment on that... the beds werent extremely comfortable a bit hard maybe... but the staff was really cool and helpful and really kind.... especially Gianni! he was soo adorable.... always really helpful and kind.... lol.... and even the other dude dont know his name who worked nights was mostly cool but i think a little grouchy cause we'd often wake him up since he would be sleeping sometimes when we got back but really no complaints lol.... its a good hotel for the price and is located in a great area! over all great trip lol!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We finished 2 weeks ago our vacation in Italy, and visit for the 3-rd time this wonderful city-Rome, choosing this hotel for the end of our journey.We looked into the reviews for this hotel and I must say that we are surprised: first of all, pleasently surprised about the hotel (big,clean,spacious rooms, great, helpful staff- Gianni is the best!!!, very nice location). Second of all,the reviews for this hotel from other "guests" are putting the place into the badest light possible: Dont listen to them. Visit Rome and stay at Dorica-you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytrip4us
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, I would never stay there again. Hotel is fine, nice location, but the staff is so horrible, it's not worth the aggravation. We stayed here in Sept 04, and after our 2nd night, the hotel owner kicked myself, husband and two year old out. We were on the streets of Rome at night, with a baby and no where to stay. They kicked us out because our 2 year old had accidentaly locked herself in the bathroom, and the hotel did not have a key to open the door. They had to break down the door, and then asked us to leave. They proceeded to yell and scream at us, calling us names, and threatening us. All because of a mistake that a toddler made. DO NOT STAY HERE! There are other hotels in the area that are just as nice, and have much friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Plain hotel but nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 2004. It is located about 10-15 mins by foot from Termini and is surrounded by an array of small shops and pizzerias. The rooms are clean but small, and the bathrooms had nice showers with good water pressure (this can be hard to find in some of the smaller Italian hotels). The breakfasts were not that great - breads were dry, and there was not much to choose from - but for the price I did not expect much. The only warm breakfast item was coffee. The owners are friendly and speak English, but there was one clerk who I found a bit rude when asking questions to. He seemed to be irritated by any interruptions. Overall this is a modest, clean, convenient hotel that met my travel needs.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dorica
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Viminale 14, 00184 Rome, Italy
